primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: God bypasses human standards of appearance and power to choose the 'runt' (David/Jesus/The Church) to carry His Spirit and transform the world.

tekstueel_bewijs: God who had designated Saul as king
God said to Samuel: 'This is the one; anoint him'
God chose what is foolish in the world

object.identificatie: A New Creation / Transformation of Social Reality
tekstueel_bewijs: the transformative power of the gospel

zender.identificatie: God (as the source of a 'Gospel Perception')
tekstueel_bewijs: the intention of God is that the little flock... is to bring to nothing... the things that are
the ones to whom God has reached in mercy
ontvanger.positie_hoorder: Does hearer identify with Subject or Receiver?

tekstueel_bewijs: the Spirit of God came upon him
Samuel is directed to dismiss the claims
helper.rol_van_god: God is the primary Subject; the Spirit is the empowering Helper.

tegenstander.identificatie: The 'Human Point of View' / Social Categorization
tekstueel_bewijs: a society that judges by power, by money, by appearance
tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: The opponent is described as 'the norms of death' and a systemic blindness that opposes God's creative work.

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The church (Subject) adopts the ministry of reconciliation (Object) by seeing others through God's eyes.
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: The Gospel Community (The Hearers)
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: The secondary program is presented as a direct consequence of having been reached by God in the primary program.

actantieel_schema_visualisatie.helper_subject_tegenstander: The Spirit → God ← Human Standards of Appearance

voorbeelden_god_subject: God chose what is weak in the world.
God has reached out to us in our nothingness.
voorbeelden_mens_subject: We regard no one from a human point of view.

voorbeelden: we must ask, how shall we hear this story
no longer willing or able simply to slot
the capacity to see and value differently
God is at work with transformative power
the Spirit of God came upon him
we are able to make that reach because we know...

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon focuses on the 'Pouvoir' (Power) of God that grants a new 'Savoir' (Perception) to the believer. It avoids 'Devoir' (Legalism).

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: From S2 (Saul/Appearance) to ~S1 (Samuel's confusion) to S1 (David/Spirit) to ~S2 (The Church's ministry).
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: God's choice of the 'nothing' nullifies the 'things that are,' resolving the tension through divine sovereign election.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: High; the 'human point of view' is equated with death and the exclusion of the poor.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: The sermon is strongly theocentric. God is the primary actor who initiates the choice of David, the sending of Jesus, and the calling of the church. Human action is a response to divine initiative.

indicatoren_moralisme.tekstueel_bewijs: And we may do the same where we live.

indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: God has reached out to us in our nothingness and made us new.
the norms of the world that are the norms of death.

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: David is not used as a model of virtue to imitate, but as a sign of God's unexpected choice.
bijbelse_figuren_als_model: David (as a sign, not a hero)

identificatie_patroon.effect_op_hoorder: Relief and empowerment; the hearer is the 'runt' who has been chosen.
identificatie_patroon.theologische_implicatie: Soteriology precedes ethics; being precedes doing.

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: The transition from the OT story to the NT theology and contemporary application is seamless and structurally consistent.
spanning_punten: The tension between 'walking by faith' (slow) and the 'human point of view' (fast).

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: if anyone is in Christ, there is a new creation

pneumatologie.competentie_schenking: The Spirit provides the 'Pouvoir' (Power) to be a new creation.

hamartologie.ernst_diagnose: Sin is seen as a systemic blindness ('human point of view') that leads to death.

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The sermon maintains God as the Subject of the primary narrative program. The hearer is positioned as the Receiver of grace before being called as a Subject of the secondary program (reconciliation).

modale_balans.voorgestelde_balans: Maintain the current focus on Pouvoir (God's Power).
modale_balans.concrete_suggestie: Ensure the 'ministry of reconciliation' is always linked to the Spirit's power, not just a change in mindset.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: This sermon is a masterclass in theocentric narrative. It successfully moves from a biblical type to a contemporary reality without falling into moralism.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: While a rhetorical analysis would focus on the 'Who knew?' refrain, semiotics reveals that this refrain marks the 'Subject-switch' from human expectation to divine action.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Exegesis might focus on the historical context of Bethlehem; Greimas shows how the 'runt' functions as a universal actant for the 'marginalized carrier of value'.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Greimas helps identify that the 'Human Point of View' is not just a mistake but a structural Opponent that requires a new 'Modal Competence' (Pouvoir) to overcome.

volledige_subject_lijst: God (designated, told, sent, whispered, said, chose, reached out)
Samuel (grieved, knew, protested, came, saw, poured)
We (categorize, stereotype, slot, value, walk, regard)
appendices.notnotes: The sermon effectively uses the 'Who knew?' motif to signal the narrative disruption caused by the divine Subject.
